newsitem.title: UK: UK physical grains quiet, marginally firmer.
newsitem.headline: UK physical grains quiet, marginally firmer.

text.p: The British physical grains market was quiet ahead of the long holiday weekend.
Prices reported traded during the day were marginally firmer than on Thursday, although brokers said there was no strong pattern of change.
"It's been up and down all week," one said.
Traders still complain that supply is limited as low prices keep sellers away from the market. "Physical grain is hard to come by," one said.

With British wheat competitive with French supplies into the important Spanish and Portuguese export markets, he was confident that the UK's surplus would be overwhelmingly absorbed before new crop supplies come onto the market.
Brokers reported feed wheat traded for East Anglia at 90.50 and 91.00 stg for June delivery, with barley done for Norfolk/Suffolk at 90.00 stg for May.
